definition: lit. to drive a lightweight chariot on a familiar road (idiom)/fig. to do sth routinely and with ease/a walk in the park

sentences.english: Scherdel said the first flight was a familiarization flight for he and the team.
sentences.chinese: 謝爾德說這次首航對他和隊友們來說是輕車熟路。

sentences.english: I knew my way around town in 2 weeks, I spoke the language in 6 months.
sentences.chinese: 兩星期我就熟門熟路，六個月就能講當地的語言。

sentences.english: He knows his way in the dark.
Mr. Eastwood's on familiar ground in another way.
sentences.chinese: 克林伊斯威特在另一方面也熟門熟路。

sentences.english: The waitress passes a fine menu to Molly who orders dishes adroitly.
sentences.chinese: 女服務生捧來菜單遞給茉莉，後者輕車熟路地點菜。

sentences.english: The second day, age horse yet etc. in familiar road in versed door in the gateway left Yi.
sentences.chinese: 第二日，老馬已經在門口熟門熟路的等左伊了。

sentences.english: 2， After a week, you'll be running around here like a pro.
sentences.chinese: 一星期之後你就會輕車熟路了。

sentences.english: Randt, who stepped down from his ambassadorial post in January, knows his way around China.
sentences.chinese: 雷德1月份從大使職位離職，在中國熟門熟路。

sentences.english: The college football player knew his way around the locker room better than he did the library.
sentences.chinese: 大學足球選手對更衣儲藏比圖書館更輕車熟路。

definition: lit. to drive a lightweight chariot on a familiar road (idiom)/fig. to do sth routinely and with ease/a walk in the park
novice/new hand/sb new to a job
to ask for directions/to ask the way (to some place)
by the way/while out doing sth else/conveniently
to make a detour/to take the long route
to take the back roads/to take the side streets/to take the small paths
to be fooled/to be taken in (by a ruse)
